intro: Uapaca letestuana, commonly known as the Kipiro tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, bark-like trunk and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, white flowers followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas and along riverbanks.
